title: Prince Harry's Memoir, 'Spare,' Set for Jan. 10 Release; Book comes at a time when the Duke of Sussex's relationship with the royal family has been strained
text:
The memoir will include the Duke of Sussex's account of the death of his mother, Princess Diana, Penguin Random House said in a statement Thursday. It will also include his memories of walking alongside his brother, Prince William, as they followed their mother's coffin during her funeral, the book publisher said.

"For Harry, this is his story at last," Penguin Random House said.

The publication of Prince Harry's memoir follows the September death of his grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II, and comes at a time when the Duke of Sussex's relationship with the royal family has been strained. After his father, King Charles III, acceded to the throne, he is now fifth in line.

Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, stepped back as senior members of Britain's royal family in 2020. In a high-profile television interview in 2021 with Oprah Winfrey, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex said their relationship with the royal family suffered from coverage in the British tabloid press. The couple also said that racism was a major factor in their decision to relocate from the U.K. to the U.S.

Buckingham Palace issued a statement at the time saying it was concerned about the race issues raised by the couple.

In California, Prince Harry and Meghan launched several business ventures, including an exclusive podcast series with Spotify Technology SA. Meghan's "Archetypes" podcast on Spotify is currently ranked seventh on the site. The couple also signed a deal with Netflix Inc.

Prince Harry has worked with Ms. Winfrey on a mental-health series for Apple Inc., while Meghan narrated a documentary on elephants for Walt Disney Co.

The royal family put up a united front as family members gathered in the U.K. to mourn Queen Elizabeth. Prince William, Prince Harry and their wives walked together outside Windsor Castle to greet well-wishers. And King Charles included the Sussexes in his address to the nation, expressing his love for the couple "as they continue to build their lives overseas."

But several moments highlighted lingering tensions. Some royal watchers say Prince Harry's memoir and other projects from the couple's media company Archewell could add renewed pressure.

Prince Harry's memoir will be published in 16 languages, Penguin Random House said. An audio version of the book narrated by Prince Harry will also be released on Jan. 10.

"He shares a remarkably moving personal journey from trauma to healing, one that speaks to the power of love and will inspire and encourage millions of people around the world," said Markus Dohle, chief executive of Penguin Random House.
